subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Testing for Swing JTables
msgSnippet: Hi Gareth, In general, there are two kinds of automation involved on any JComponent. They are: (i) automating the functionality using API methods and JUnit and
messageBody:
Hi Gareth,

In general, there are two kinds of automation involved
on any JComponent. They are: (i) automating the
functionality using API methods and JUnit and (ii)
automating the UI with JUnit extensions like JFCUnit
and Abbot.

The strategy would be to define the JTable in a test
method with rows and column and start automating the
features/functionalities of JTable in any of the
aforementioned.

I am not really sure about your exact requirements.
Please mail me back if you have any specific scenario
that you want to automate using JUnit.

Thanks and Regards,
Saldin


--- ni0270 <gareth.porter@...> wrote:

> Hi,
>
> Does anyone have a useful strategy for applying
> JUnit tests for Swing
> JTables?
>
> Many thanks in advance,
> Gareth
>
>
>
>
>
>
